monitoring 0.1.0
  • Reference

Import submission data from KoboToolbox

Source: R/monitoring.R
kobo.Rd

This function connects to the KoboToolbox API and downloads the submission data of a specified form (identified by its asset UID). It returns the data as a data frame, with cleaned column names.

kobo(username, password, form_id, server = "kobotoolbox", output_dir = getwd())

Arguments

username

Character. Your KoboToolbox username.

password

Character. Your KoboToolbox password.

form_id

Character. The unique identifier of the KoboToolbox form (asset UID).

server

Character. Either "kobotoolbox" (default) or "humanitarian" to specify the server type.

output_dir

Character. Directory to which files might be written (reserved for future use). Must exist. Defaults to current working directory.

Value

A data frame containing the form submission data. Returns NULL if no data is available. Stops with an informative error message if the request fails.

Details

Column names are cleaned by:

  • Removing any prefix up to the last `/`

  • Removing leading and trailing underscores

  • Replacing multiple consecutive underscores with a single underscore

  • Ensuring uniqueness of column names

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
df <- kobo(
  username = "my_user",
  password = "my_password",
  form_id = "a1b2c3d4e5f6g7h8i9",
  server = "humanitarian"
)
head(df)
} # }
